nodes.name: MEAN STD OF DEMAND
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT
    IDNRK,
    MEAN(WEEKLY_DEMAND) as WEEKLY_MEAN_DEMAND,
    stddev_samp(WEEKLY_DEMAND) as WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND,
    MAX(WEEKLY_DEMAND) as WEEKLY_MAX_DEMAND
from fire_temp_table
GROUP by IDNRK
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: SS Calculation
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT
    *,
    1.64 * WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND * SQRT(LEAD_TIME_DAYS) / 7 as SS_STATS_95SLA,
    2.05 * WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND * SQRT(LEAD_TIME_DAYS) / 7 as SS_STATS_98SLA,
    2.33 * WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND * SQRT(LEAD_TIME_DAYS) / 7 as SS_STATS_99SLA,
    3.09 * WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND * SQRT(LEAD_TIME_DAYS) / 7 as SS_STATS_100SLA,
    WEEKLY_MEAN_DEMAND * LEAD_TIME_DAYS / 7 as SS_TIME_COVERAGE,
    (WEEKLY_MAX_DEMAND - WEEKLY_MEAN_DEMAND) * LEAD_TIME_DAYS / 7 as SS_MAX_AVG
from fire_temp_table
ORDER BY
    IDNRK
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Valuation of SS
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT *,
    IFNULL(SS_STATS_95SLA, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_95SLA,
    IFNULL(SS_STATS_98SLA, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_98SLA,
    IFNULL(SS_STATS_99SLA, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_99SLA,
    IFNULL(SS_STATS_100SLA, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_100SLA,
    IFNULL(SS_TIME_COVERAGE, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_TIMECOVG,
    IFNULL(SS_MAX_AVG, 0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_MAXAVG,
    IFNULL(CURRENT_SS_WITHIN,0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_CURRENT_WI,
    IFNULL(CURRENT_SS_OVELALL,0) * UNIT_PRICE as SS_COST_CURRENT_ALL
from fire_temp_table
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.title: Output Column Types

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT
    CAST(ROUND(SUM(SS_COST_95SLA), 2) AS DECIMAL(15,2)) AS TOTAL_SS_COST_95SLA,
    CAST(ROUND(SUM(SS_COST_100SLA), 2) AS DECIMAL(15,2)) AS TOTAL_SS_COST_100SLA,
    CAST(ROUND(SUM(SS_COST_CURRENT_WI), 2) AS DECIMAL(15,2)) AS TOTAL_CURRENT_SS_COST_WI,
    CAST(ROUND(SUM(SS_COST_CURRENT_ALL), 2) AS DECIMAL(15,2)) AS TOTAL_CURRENT_SS_COST_ALL
FROM fire_temp_table;
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.name: sql

SELECT
    bb.*,
    aa.LEAD_TIME_DAYS
FROM tempTable1 aa INNER JOIN tempTable2 bb
on aa.IDNRK = bb.IDNRK

nodes.name: Current SS Calculation (S)
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
WITH latest_month_data AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM fire_temp_table
  WHERE DATE_TRUNC('month', BU_DATE) = (
      SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', MAX(BU_DATE)) FROM fire_temp_table
  )
),

-- Rank only non-zero stock rows
non_zero_ranked AS (
  SELECT *,
         ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
           PARTITION BY IDNRK
           ORDER BY BU_DATE_year, BU_DATE_month, BU_DATE_dayofmonth
         ) AS rn_nonzero
  FROM latest_month_data
  WHERE EISBE != 0
),

-- Rank all rows as fallback
all_ranked AS (
  SELECT *,
         ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
           PARTITION BY IDNRK
           ORDER BY BU_DATE_year, BU_DATE_month, BU_DATE_dayofmonth
         ) AS rn_all
  FROM latest_month_data
),

-- Pick the top rows from each
non_zero_pick AS (
  SELECT IDNRK, BU_DATE AS CURRENT_STOCK_DATE, EISBE AS CURRENT_STOCK
  FROM non_zero_ranked
  WHERE rn_nonzero = 1
),

fallback_pick AS (
  SELECT IDNRK, BU_DATE AS fallback_date, EISBE AS fallback_stock
  FROM all_ranked
  WHERE rn_all = 1
)

-- Final result with fallback logic
SELECT
  f.IDNRK,
  COALESCE(n.CURRENT_STOCK_DATE, f.fallback_date) AS CURRENT_STOCK_DATE,
  COALESCE(n.CURRENT_STOCK, f.fallback_stock) AS CURRENT_STOCK
FROM fallback_pick f
LEFT JOIN non_zero_pick n ON f.IDNRK = n.IDNRK
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Output Column Types
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT
  IDNRK,
  ROUND(WEEKLY_MEAN_DEMAND, 2) AS WEEKLY_MEAN_DEMAND,
  ROUND(WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND, 2) AS WEEKLY_STD_DEMAND,
  ROUND(WEEKLY_MAX_DEMAND, 2) AS WEEKLY_MAX_DEMAND,
  MATERIAL_NAME,
  BASE_UNIT,
  ROUND(UNIT_PRICE, 2) AS UNIT_PRICE,
  ROUND(LOT_SIZE, 2) AS LOT_SIZE,
  LEAD_TIME_DAYS,
  ROUND(SS_STATS_95SLA, 2) AS SS_STATS_95SLA,
  ROUND(SS_STATS_98SLA, 2) AS SS_STATS_98SLA,
  ROUND(SS_STATS_99SLA, 2) AS SS_STATS_99SLA,
  ROUND(SS_STATS_100SLA, 2) AS SS_STATS_100SLA,
  ROUND(SS_TIME_COVERAGE, 2) AS SS_TIME_COVERAGE,
  ROUND(SS_MAX_AVG, 2) AS SS_MAX_AVG,
  ROUND(SS_COST_95SLA, 2) AS SS_COST_95SLA,
  ROUND(SS_COST_98SLA, 2) AS SS_COST_98SLA,
  ROUND(SS_COST_99SLA, 2) AS SS_COST_99SLA,
  ROUND(SS_COST_100SLA, 2) AS SS_COST_100SLA,
  ROUND(SS_COST_TIMECOVG, 2) AS SS_COST_TIMECOVG,
  ROUND(SS_COST_MAXAVG, 2) AS SS_COST_MAXAVG,
  ROUND(CURRENT_SS_WITHIN, 2) AS CURRENT_SS_WITHIN,
  ROUND(CURRENT_SS_OVELALL, 2) AS CURRENT_SS_OVELALL,
  ROUND(SS_COST_CURRENT_WI, 2) AS SS_COST_CURRENT_WI,
  ROUND(SS_COST_CURRENT_ALL, 2) AS SS_COST_CURRENT_ALL
FROM fire_temp_table

fields.name: title
fields.value: SKU-wise Safety Stock Comparison Across SLA Levels
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: Compares safety stock levels for each SKU across current stock, 95% and 100% SLA targets, enabling a clear understanding of how service level changes impact inventory requirements.

fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.
